content.title: The Trans-Planckian Problem
content.summary: The trans-Planckian problem highlights a deep tension between inflationary cosmology and quantum gravity. Modes that we observe today in the cosmic microwave background originated with wavelengths far smaller than the Planck length during inflation, raising questions about the validity of calculations that ignore quantum gravity.

problem_statement.description: During inflation, spacetime expanded exponentially. Physical wavelengths that correspond to observable cosmological scales today (λ ~ Mpc) were, at the beginning of inflation, far smaller than the Planck length.

calculation.redshift_factor: e^N where N ~ 60 e-folds of inflation
calculation.comparison: ℓ_P ~ 10⁻³⁵ m, so λ_initial >> ℓ_P only if inflation lasted ≤ 60-70 e-folds

problem_statement.issue: For inflation lasting > 70 e-folds, currently observable modes had initial wavelengths λ < ℓ_P, where standard physics is unknown.

manifestations.problem: Primordial fluctuations from inflation may have originated in trans-Planckian regime
manifestations.consequence: Unknown quantum gravity effects could modify the nearly scale-invariant power spectrum

manifestations.problem: Modes at infinity trace back to arbitrarily high (trans-Planckian) frequencies near the horizon
manifestations.consequence: Hawking temperature calculation may be sensitive to UV physics

manifestations.problem: Vacuum modes evolve from trans-Planckian to sub-Planckian scales
manifestations.consequence: Choice of vacuum state may depend on Planck-scale physics

approaches_to_resolution.description: Energy-momentum relation E² = p²c² + m²c⁴ modified at Planck energies
approaches_to_resolution.prediction: Potential suppression or enhancement of high-k modes

approaches_to_resolution.description: Alternative to Bunch-Davies vacuum that accounts for trans-Planckian effects
Treat trans-Planckian regime as boundary condition
approaches_to_resolution.prediction: Results should be insensitive to details above cutoff

approaches_to_resolution.description: String theory provides natural UV completion with minimum length
approaches_to_resolution.prediction: Specific modifications depending on string scenario

approaches_to_resolution.description: Discrete spacetime naturally regulates trans-Planckian behavior
approaches_to_resolution.prediction: Possible signatures from quantum bounce replacing singularity

cmb_power_spectrum.trans_planckian_modifications: Possible oscillations or running at specific k-scales
cmb_power_spectrum.current_constraints: Planck satellite data shows no significant deviations

tensor_perturbations.sensitivity: May be more sensitive to trans-Planckian effects than scalar modes

non_gaussianity.sensitivity: Some trans-Planckian models predict distinctive non-Gaussian signatures

current_status.theoretical: Active research area with no consensus resolution
current_status.significance: Illustrates deep connection between quantum gravity and observable cosmology
